newsitem.title: VIETNAM: New fish discovered in Vietnam's "lost world".
newsitem.headline: New fish discovered in Vietnam's "lost world".

text.p: Scientists in Vietnam said on Friday they had discovered a new fish species in a "lost world" region on the mountainous border with Laos.

A World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) statement said the freshwater fish had been found by scientist Dr Nguyen Thai Tu during a recent expedition into the remote Vu Quang nature reserve in northern central Vietnam.
It measures about 20-25 cm (7.8-9.8 inches) in length, has a golden stripe on its back, a silver belly, weighs about 1.5 kg (3.3 pounds) and belongs to the Crossocheilus genus, the statement said.

Vu Quang has already yielded several spectacular wildlife finds, including the discovery in 1992 of a deer-like animal known as the giant muntjac, or Vu Quang ox -- one of only seven new mammals discovered this century.

WWF officials said on Friday that the find underscored the need to ensure conservation of the area. The statement referred to Vu Quang as a "lost world seemingly untouched by the war and possibly teeming with new species."
